Hi tizo,

> I need that information, because I have to write a customized
>=
 extractor, that will extract POST links from forms, and those
> generally =
are to be downloaded with differents parameters. I think
> that code won't =
be of interest to Heritrix, because is not so generic
> (lot of input data,=
 specific to particulars sites, are needed to
> perform this tasks), but if=
 you think it could be used, just tell me.

I also started work on a custom=
 extractor based on HTMLExtractor. 
My primary goal is to be able to fill o=
ut FORMs with default values.
I decided to not take the "regular expression=
"-way as the
HTMLExtractor currently does, but base my work on jerichoHTML =
parser
(http://jerichohtml.sourceforge.net). 
The current results seem quit=
e promising (it is just a few percent
slower than the HTMLExtractor but use=
s significantly less memory and
it passes all unit test that HTMLExtractor =
does).
If everything fares well I might be able to provide my extractor to
=
the cummunity next month.

Olaf Freyer
